content.question: The electric potential energy stored in a capacitor is <math alttext="8.0 times 10 to the negative 5 power, joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>8.0</mtext><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mstyle></math> when the amount of charge on the capacitor is <math alttext="8.0 times 10 to the negative 6 power, coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>8.0</mtext><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is most nearly the capacitance of the capacitor?

choices.label: <math alttext="4.0 times 10 to the negative 7 power, farad" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>4.0</mtext><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>F</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="8.0 times 10 to the negative 7 power, farad" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>8.0</mtext><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>F</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.6 times 10 to the negative 6 power, farad" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>1.6</mtext><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>F</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.0 times 10 to the negative 1 power, farad" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>1.0</mtext><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>F</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4.0 times 10 to the negative 7 power, farad" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>4.0</mtext><mo>×</mo><msup><mtext>10</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>F</mtext></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
